thread.title: 'Drunk' driver arrested after he tries to order McDonald's from a CAR WASH and then crashes into fence
thread.title_full: 'Drunk' driver arrested after he tries to order McDonald's from a CAR WASH and then crashes into fence

author: mirror
title: 'Drunk' driver arrested after he tries to order McDonald's from a CAR WASH and then crashes into fence
text:
News 'Drunk' driver arrested after he tries to order McDonald's from a CAR WASH and then crashes into fence Police say: "Remember guys don't drink and drive it's not worth it" as they nick driver in early hours of the morning Share The 'drunk' driver found himself still in custody at 9am in the morning after the error (Photo: Rex) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Lancashire man has been arrested after mistaking a car wash for a McDonald's drive thru. 
Police in Ribble Valley said the 26-year-old man made the botched take-away order, then drove into a car wash next door before colliding with and damaging a fence outside the restaurant. 
He was arrested close to the McDonald's just off the A59 in the early hours of this morning, reports Lancashire Telegraph. 
In a Facebook post, Ribble Valley police, said: "Well another drink driver fails to get past Clitheroe police after thinking that he can attend McDonald's and order some take away food. The police said on Facebook: "Remember guys don't drink and drive it's not worth it." (Photo: Ribble Valley Police Facebook) 
"Unfortunately for the driver he thought the car wash next door was the drive thru and he ended being taken away to custody. 
"Remember guys don't drink and drive it's not worth it." 
At 9am the suspect remained in custody after being arrested on suspicion of drink driving. Like us on Facebook
